'''{{PAGENAME}}''' is a [[Pillars of Eternity II: Deadfire world map|location]] in {{poe2}}. It is located on an unmarked island at the coordinates 21° 5'S, 51° 14'E. [[Tangaloa's Maw]] is to the east.

==Background==
As the name suggests, this is a forgotten underground burial site in the middle of nowhere.
{{Description|A lush, narrow valley lies below you. You spot an overgrown stone structure build into the valley's side in the distance.

Before the stone structure spreads a broad field peppered with ancient plinths and mounds of cracked stonework.

As you move closer, you discover that the stone structure is actually the entrance to a crypt. Though the doorway is thick with mud and as damp as sweat-slick skin, you continue down into the dark.}}

==Points of interest==
* This isn't a big location: The central throne room is where the [[Death Guard]] fanatic has established his lair, gathering various valuables and other baubles. He drops the [[Reckless Brigandine]]. Oh, and there's also undead all over.
* In the center is a Sigil of Atrophy, which applies [[Status effects (Deadfire)#Curses|Curse of Atrophy]] (-2 Might, stacks up to 5 times). Destroy it from a distance, or use a [[Sigil of Atrophy Wardstone]] to mitigate it's effects. There are traps surrounding it which causes it to attack if stepped on, these attacks cause [[Status effects (Deadfire)#Serious Burn|Serious Burn]] (-2 Dexterity, -3 Burn Armor Rating). When the sigil is destroyed, the traps are deactivated.
* Upon leaving the catacombs, you get to name the island as part of [[Mapping the Archipelago: Tikawara]].
